Truist Financial

Defining the Digital Experience for America's 7th Largest Bank

I built and scaled a 30-person design organization at SunTrust — owning every line of business — then led business and commercial banking design through the largest bank merger since 2008.

The Challenge

Two legacy banks became one. The digital experience had to earn that trust from day one.

I inherited a small, nascent UX team at SunTrust with no research function, no UI practice, and no independent design voice. I scaled it to a 30-person multidisciplinary organization covering consumer, small business, wealth management, and commercial banking. When the $66B merger with BB&T created Truist, I led business and commercial banking design through the transition — rebuilding product experiences for the merged entity and translating the new Truist brand into a design system deployed across all digital products.

My Role

Head of UX Design & Research

Company

SunTrust → Truist Financial

Scope

All lines of business (SunTrust); Business & Commercial Banking (Truist); Design System

Team

UX/UI Designers, Researchers, Product Managers, Engineering

The Ecosystem

One design language across every surface.

At SunTrust, I owned every digital touchpoint — consumer mobile, business banking, and the web platform. That breadth meant the design system had to hold together across radically different use cases and user needs.

Consumer Mobile

Account management, transfers, and day-to-day banking designed for speed and clarity.

Business Banking

Multi-account management, notifications, and commercial tools for business clients.

Web Platform

Full-featured dashboard with spending analytics, account activity, and cross-product visibility.

Going Deeper

The details that make banking feel effortless.

Every flow — from transferring money to verifying your identity — was designed to reduce friction and build confidence.

Core Interaction Flows

Transfers, chat, and confirmations — designed as a system, not screens.

Cross-Device Payments

Transfers and QR payments across mobile, web, and wearables.

Biometric Security

Facial recognition and biometric authentication integrated seamlessly into the experience.

Responsive Design System

Consistent brand expression from mobile to desktop to tablet.

Onboarding

First impressions, done right.

Opening an account is the first real relationship moment. I pushed the team to treat onboarding not as a form, but as a conversation — progressive disclosure, clear progress, and a sense that the bank actually cares about getting to know you.

Wealth Management

Designing for the highest-value clients.

The wealth management platform required a different register — sophisticated, information-dense, and built for clients managing substantial portfolios. The same design system, elevated for a different audience.
